question: Which of the following were two rival sets of Judicial institutions in India before enactment of Indian High Courts Act, 1861?
explanation: Prior to the passing of the Indian High Courts Act, 1861, there were two rival sets of judicial institutions in India, viz. Crown's Courts and Company Courts. The Supreme Courts established in the Presidency towns of Calcutta, Madras and Bombay were the courts of the British Crown while the Adalats established in District / Mofiissil areas were the courts of the East India Company.
